page.title: 16Warkworth Waterworks
page.content: Warkworth Waterworks are situated by the River Coquet and are operated by the Northumbrian Water Authority. Ten million gallons of water are extracted daily from the river.The water is purified and distributed by the Newcastle and Gateshead Water Company to towns and villages throughout Northumberland and Tyneside.Outside the works there is an underground reservoir,25 feet deep,where 50 million gallons of water are held.Inside the works the whole purifying cycle is completed by 9 men.Fluoride, allum and chlorine are added to the water. The waterworks incorporate a fishpass which enables salmon and trout to pass up river.The Northumberian Water Authority bailiffs use the pass to record the number of fish in the Coquet.
